e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and integrity. It should provide truthful and unbiased financial information so all investors, regardless of sophistication, can make well-informed decisions. It must comply with regulatory standards, avoid any misleading practices, and ensure that all stakeholders are equally informed. Consistent communication and education efforts are necessary to clarify any transitions or complexities to allay potential misunderstandings among investors. Promoting fairness and trust should be at the core of any ethical financial reporting policy.
e6: Yes, I would ask the management team about their plan for communicating the policy change to investors effectively. How will they ensure that all stakeholders, especially retail investors, understand the true EPS without the need for informal adjustments? Additionally, what measures will be taken to prevent any market misinterpretation or adverse reactions?
